reference.shortdesc: The pre element contains text for which all line breaks and spaces are preserved. It is typically presented in a monospaced font. Do not use pre when a more semantically specific element is appropriate, such as codeblock.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following example will preserve all line breaks and white space.
example.codeblock:
MEMO: programming team fun day
Remember to bring a kite, softball glove, or other favorite
outdoor accessory to tomorrow's fun day outing at Zilker Park.
Volunteers needed for the dunking booth.
example.p: The rendered result will differ depending on the processor that is rendering your DITA content. It will generally look something like this: MEMO: programming team fun day Remember to bring a kite, softball glove, or other favorite outdoor accessory to tomorrow's fun day outing at Zilker Park. Volunteers needed for the dunking booth.
